Method Detail

openTerm

IPrologTermOutput openTerm(java.lang.String functor)
Start a new term. This methods prints the (escaped, if needed) functor and the opening brackets. All other terms (atoms, numbers, variables, ...) are printed as arguments of this term until it is closed with closeTerm(). Same as openTerm(String, boolean) with false as second argument.

Parameters:
functor - the functor, never null.

openTerm

IPrologTermOutput openTerm(java.lang.String functor,
                           boolean ignoreIndention)
Start a new term. This methods prints the (escaped, if needed) functor and the opening brackets. All other terms (atoms, numbers, variables, ...) are printed as arguments of this term until it is closed with closeTerm(). You should close all opened terms. Use this method instead of openTerm(String) if you want to control whether the arguments of the term should be indented or not. This is useful to write terms more compact when you know that they are always short.

Parameters:
functor - the functor, never null
ignoreIndention - if this is set to true, the arguments of this term are not subject to indent.

closeTerm

IPrologTermOutput closeTerm()
Finish a term that was started with openTerm(String). This method basically prints the closing parenthesis.

Returns:

printAtom

IPrologTermOutput printAtom(java.lang.String content)
Print an atom. The atom will be escaped, if needed.

Parameters:
content - the name of the atom, never null
Returns:

printAtomOrNumber

IPrologTermOutput printAtomOrNumber(java.lang.String content)
Print an atom or number. Use this for State ID!

Parameters:
content - the name of the atom, never null
Returns:

printString

IPrologTermOutput printString(java.lang.String content)
Print a string. The content of the string will be escaped, if needed.

Parameters:
content - the string content, never null
Returns:

Print a number.

Parameters:
number - the number to print
Returns:

openList

IPrologTermOutput openList()
Start a new list. All following terms (atoms, numbers, etc.) until the next call of closeList() are put into the list. All opened lists should be closed. Basically this method prints the opening bracket.

Returns:

closeList

IPrologTermOutput closeList()
Finish a list that was started with openList(). Basically this method prints the closing bracket.

Returns:

emptyList

IPrologTermOutput emptyList()
Print an empty list.

Returns:

printVariable

IPrologTermOutput printVariable(java.lang.String var)
Print a Prolog variable. Variables should start with an upper case character (or underscore) and should not contain spaces (and other illegal characters). For variables, no escaping is done.

Parameters:
var - the name of the variable, never null
Returns:
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the variable is not a syntactically valid Prolog variable.

IPrologTermOutput printTerm(PrologTerm term)
Print a complete Term.

Parameters:
term - the term, never null
Returns:
